ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.test

Class StoryTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • android.test.InstrumentationTestCase
          • android.test.ActivityTestCase
            • android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2<StoryEditActivity>
              • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.test.StoryTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Test

    public class StoryTest
extends ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2<StoryEditActivity>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StoryTest()
      Default constructor; doesn't do anything fancy except for initializing the testCases

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testConstructorWithArguments()
      Tests to see if constructor works when we give it the arguments of the story title and also author Actually this works the same way as the previous test in that the author and title are defaulted to "" even with contructors
      void testDefaultConstructor()
      Tests to see if the default constructor is working properly We test to see if a new story has "" as its author and title as this is what it should be when the story is created with no arguments
      void testGetAndSetFragments()
      This test ensures that the getting of setting of the Fragments(list of Fragment) works correctly We will add our own Fragment List and make sure that it is the same as the one we set to the Story We will then test if getFragmentAtPos works correctly which is supposed to return the fragment as any position
      void testGetStartFragPos()
      Tests too see if the getStartFragPos is workign correctly StartFragPos is always default to zero so we check if it is zero
      void testGetTitle()
      Tests to see if the GetTitle function works to do this we first make a new story with title test and see if the title is "" which is the fault title
      void testSetAuthorAndGetAuthor()
      This test checks if the getter and setter methods for the Author field work correctly We will create a new story object, change the author and see if we get the changed author string back
      void testSetTitle()
      Tests to see if the setTitle function works to do this we first make a new story with title "test" and see if the title is "test" then we use the setTitle to set the title to "changed" and ensure that the title has been changed
      void testUpdateIdAndGetId()
      Tests if the GetID works getId returns the current id of the object which should never be -1 This is becuase the id is a hash of the author and title strings
